entry.title: Movie: The Best Two Years, directed by Scott S. Anderson (2003)
entry.content:
Movie: The Best Two Years, directed by Scott S. Anderson (2003)20130520
This is a fun movie. I recommended it to someone to learn about
missionaries, so I wanted to watch it again and remember what it
was like. Definitely good.
  • Movies
  • 2003

entry.title: Game: Final Fantasy 5 (SNES, 1992) (8)
entry.content:
Game: Final Fantasy 5 (SNES, 1992) (8)20130519
I played for about three hours and got the first tablet in
World 3. Some of the random battles have been very tough. I like
this game, but I feel like I know what is going to happen because
I'm at that point in the game where to road to end is open and
you have all the tools you'll use until the end.

In the evening I played for about an hour and beat Odin and got
some of the sealed weapons. Unfortunately I had to fight him
twice because Excalibur heals him. D'oh!

Total time: 21:49
  • Video Games
  • Final Fantasy 5
  • SNES
  • 1992

entry.title: Movie: Jack Reacher, starring Tom Cruise (2012)
entry.content:
Movie: Jack Reacher, starring Tom Cruise (2012)20130518
This was a cool movie. I like the humorous moments and thought that
the Reacher character was very interesting. I thought the romance
was too subdued and seemed just there for trailer montages. The
strategy and intrigued of Reacher was cool. I'm interested in
seeing if the books are any good. Rosamund Pike is very pretty and
Cruise is great.
  • Movies
  • 2012

entry.title: Book: Nutrition and Physical Degeneration, by Weston A. Price (1939) (9)
entry.content:
Book: Nutrition and Physical Degeneration, by Weston A. Price (1939) (9)20130517
It was fascinating to read in Chapter 9 about how the African
tribes he visited would draw and drink the blood of steers
regularly.

Chapter 10 has an interesting discussion of the morals and mores
of the Aboriginals. I like the idea that the young aren't allowed
to hunt weak animals, but should leave them for the old.
  • Books
  • 1939

entry.title: Book: Nutrition and Physical Degeneration, by Weston A. Price (1939) (8)
entry.content:
Book: Nutrition and Physical Degeneration, by Weston A. Price (1939) (8)20130512
For some reason the pictures in chapter 8 were the
grossest. Nothing really new in terms of nutrition, but it was fun
to read about the islanders a little.
  • Books
  • 1939

entry.title: Movie: The Godfather Part II, by Francis Ford Coppola (1974) (2)
entry.content:
Movie: The Godfather Part II, by Francis Ford Coppola (1974) (2)20130512
We watched the rest and it was great. The end was not as powerful,
but it was very somber and gave the feeling the story needed to end
on. When Michael closes the door on Kay without a word... that's so
brutal.
  • Movies
  • 1974

entry.title: Game: Sin & Punishment: Star Successor (Wii, 2009) (16)
entry.content:
Game: Sin & Punishment: Star Successor (Wii, 2009) (16)20130511
I played this game and beat it on Easy with Isa & Kachi. It took 2
hours and 47 minutes. I got new high scores on Stages 5 and 7. I
decided to make this little table to track my progress as I play
it regularly. This game is so amazing. I watched all the
cut-scenes today and they are nuts.

| Level       | This Score  | This Destroyed | Best Score  | Best Destroyed | Rank | Last Update |
| Entire Game | 148,158,940 |          5,804 | 167,780,616 |          5,981 |   97 |             |
| Stg 0       | 8,398,850   |            197 | 8,723,894   |            208 |  250 |             |
| Stg 1       | 15,167,535  |            591 | 22,241,284  |            588 |   80 |             |
| Stg 2       | 39,905,904  |            978 | 45,181,199  |            962 |  143 |             |
| Stg 3       | 22,718,971  |          1,015 | 26,431,258  |          1,035 |  136 |             |
| Stg 4       | 22,861,057  |            781 | 25,897,071  |            885 |  192 |             |
| Stg 5       | 11,280,408  |            635 | 11,280,408  |            635 |  257 | Today       |
| Stg 6       | 16,726,359  |            795 | 20,246,798  |            928 |  117 |             |
| Stg 7       | 11,099,856  |            812 | 11,099,856  |            812 |  156 | Today       |

Total time: 3:53

  • Sin & Punishment: Star Successor

  • 2009

entry.title: Book: Nutrition and Physical Degeneration, by Weston A. Price (1939) (7)
entry.content:
Book: Nutrition and Physical Degeneration, by Weston A. Price (1939) (7)20130511
It was interesting to read in Chapter 7 how the islanders
suffered from using Western clothes rather than coating their
bodies in coconut oil. He describes how it was good for their
skin, a natural sun lotion, and resisted rain.

It was cool to read about how the primitive people caught and
raised coconut crabs.
  • Books
  • 1939

entry.title: Movie: The Godfather Part II, by Francis Ford Coppola (1974)
entry.content:
Movie: The Godfather Part II, by Francis Ford Coppola (1974)20130511
We watched the first part of The Godfather Part II. It's awesome
and I think it's a bit better so far than the first one. We took a
break for the night at the intermission. I do notice that the
language is worse. Also, I think that the prequel parts are the
most interesting, but there's less of them than I thought.
  • Movies
  • 1974

entry.title: Book: Nutrition and Physical Degeneration, by Weston A. Price (1939) (6)
entry.content:
Book: Nutrition and Physical Degeneration, by Weston A. Price (1939) (6)20130510
I enjoyed the story in Chapter 6 of how the Indians got vitamin
C. At this point, these discussion are very tedious. It's the sort
of the thing that I imagine would now be settled with a large data
set and no prose.
  • Books
  • 1939

entry.title: Book: Nutrition and Physical Degeneration, by Weston A. Price (1939) (5)
entry.content:
Book: Nutrition and Physical Degeneration, by Weston A. Price (1939) (5)20130509
It's interesting that at the time chapter five was written Alaska
was not a state. It also seems that the Eskimos were more resistant
to the downsides of modern food on their teeth. Nothing
particularly new in this chapter.
  • Books
  • 1939

entry.title: Movie: Chasing Mavericks, starring Johnny Weston (2012)
entry.content:
Movie: Chasing Mavericks, starring Johnny Weston (2012)20130509
This was an interesting movie with some cool moments and good
ideas. Unfortunately overall it promotes irrationality and
irresponsibility. Frosty is a bad role model who destroys his house
because he can't deal with death. *REDACTED* has a suicidal personality
without enough risk aversion. I'm glad that didn't ignore that he
killed himself, but I would've preferred them to be a bit more
negative about it.
  • Movies
  • 2012

entry.title: Book: Nutrition and Physical Degeneration, by Weston A. Price (1939) (4)
entry.content:
Book: Nutrition and Physical Degeneration, by Weston A. Price (1939) (4)20130508
In chapter four, he continues his discussion of the moral fiber
of the primitive people, this time in the Gaelic islands. There
they almost exclusively eat fish and oat products. He talks about
a twenty year old woman who had never seen fruit or milk.

An interesting quote regarding the idea that alcohol was used
historically to prove manhood: "This one-time well-populated
Island, the misty Isle of Skye, still has one of the finest of the
famous old castles, that belonging to the Dunvegan clan. It
participated in the romantic life of Prince *REDACTED*lie. The castle
equipment still boasts the grandeur of a past glory. Among the
relics is a horn which measured the draft to be drunk by a
prospective chieftain before he could aspire to the leadership of
the clan. He must drink its contents of two quarts without
stopping."
  • Books
  • 1939

entry.title: Fringe - Season 1 - Episode 4 - The Arrival
entry.content:
Fringe - Season 1 - Episode 4 - The Arrival20130508
I found this episode very annoying. There wasn't anything
atrociously bad about it, but it kept up the absurdity of
everything being related to Dr. Bishop's past in some way. I find
it pretty obnoxious. I can imagine this show getting a lot
better, but if it stays like this... it is passable TV, but not
amazing and I wouldn't want to keep watching it.
  • TV Shows
  • Fringe

entry.title: Book: Nutrition and Physical Degeneration, by Weston A. Price (1939) (3)
entry.content:
Book: Nutrition and Physical Degeneration, by Weston A. Price (1939) (3)20130507
I love that he says "oldsters".

The first chapter was very uninformative as it rehearsed old
rhetoric and statistics that are clearly no longer relevant.

Although his travel details in chapter two are cute, it is the
classic example of "what I did last summer" writing that is a sign
of an amateur scientist.

His main point seems to be that these Swiss kids work very hard and
eat primarily bread, milk, and cheese with meat on occasion. In
contrast, the other Swiss kids had "modern" diets of refined
flours, sweets, canned goods, sweetened fruits, chocolate and
reduced use of dairy products. At this point his focus is on their
worse teeth and susceptibility to tuberculosis.
  • Books
  • 1939

entry.title: Game: Final Fantasy 5 (SNES, 1992) (7)
entry.content:
Game: Final Fantasy 5 (SNES, 1992) (7)20130506
I played for about an hour and a half. I did the whole submarine
sequence. I had some intense fights and I got the awesome Drain
Sword. I wish I could get a ton of them, because it fills up your
life really fast. I got the plot reveal that Exdeath is an evil
tree and I'm on my way to where he's from.

Total time: 17:51
  • Video Games
  • Final Fantasy 5
  • SNES
  • 1992

entry.title: Movie: Life as We Know It, starring Katherine Heigl (2010)
entry.content:
Movie: Life as We Know It, starring Katherine Heigl (2010)20130506
This was a very cute movie. It seems like it could be really cliche
and lame, but I found a lot of it very cute and fun. I thought the
interaction with the baby was very honest and fun.
  • Movies
  • 2010

entry.title: Game: Final Fantasy 5 (SNES, 1992) (6)
entry.content:
Game: Final Fantasy 5 (SNES, 1992) (6)20130505
I played for about an hour and did some story stuff and go through
the Valley. After landing on the boat prior to attacking Exdeath's
Castle, I took a break for the night. I tried to use Conjure and
Terrain a lot, but they were pretty miss more than hit. I think
Conjure might be awesome if you only had awesome Summons.

Total time: 16:25
